availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward S. Cheatham (Robertson County, Tennessee, railroad executive and politician)

body.p: Robertson County, Tennessee, railroad executive and politician. Tennessee native. Son of Richard Cheatham and Susan Sanders Cheatham. Married Jane Elenor Foster in Davidson County, Tennessee on October 19, 1841. Married to C. C. Cheatham in 1860. Father of R. A. Cheatham, Susan Cheatham, and J. E. Cheatham. Owner of E.S. Cheatham and Company grocery store. Merchant in Robertson County, Tennessee in 1850. Member of Tennessee State House of Representative between 1853 and 1855. Member of Tennessee State Senate between 1855 and 1857. Speaker of the Tennessee State Senate between 1855 and 1857. President of Louisville and Nashville Railroad company in Robertson County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved peoples in Robertson County, Tennessee in 1860. Member of Tennessee State Senate between 1861 and 1865. Speaker of the Tennessee State Senate between 1861 and 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Robertson County, District 9, p. 134-135.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Robertson County, Murfreesboro, p. 281.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Murfreesboro, p. 74.
Tennessee Marriage Records, Tennessee State Library and Records, Nashville, Tennessee, Davidson County 1838-1864 Marriages, p. 132.
Lawrence Kestenbaum, "The Political Graveyard," http://politicalgraveyard.com/families/12961.html.
National Register of Historic Places, Mansfield-Cheatham House, Springfield, Robertson County, Tennessee, National Register #78002626
